tool.name: File Format Identification
tool.description: Check multimedia files if they are corrupt or duplicated

param.name: input1
param.label: ZIP containing the files to be analysed

tool.help:
Do you have a huge number of multimedia files and you don't know if they are corrupt, or if they have the correct extension? This tool
- gives you an overview of what file types there are - checks if the extension of the files match their content - checks if there are any duplicates - checks if the content of the files is intact
Input: A ZIP containing the files to be analysed (may be a nested folder structure) Output: A report in plain text form
A possible use case are digital preservation workflows, where you want to make sure that you only preserve high-quality files for the future.
Supported file types: A wide range of image formats (pixel and vector), videos, audios, pdf, MS Office.
Find more information in `the GitHub repo <https://github.com/dasch-swiss/fileidentification>`_.
